result.execSummary:
The defendant Konrad S Hajdukiewicz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Konrad S Hajdukiewicz is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Konrad S Hajdukiewicz was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: -Cash bail applied to fine. Fine paid in full.
-Cash bail applied to DNA Surcharge. Paid in full.

10:53 AM Defendant Konrad S Hajdukiewicz in court.  Attorney David Andrew Bolles in court for Konrad S Hajdukiewicz.  Attorney Shawn N Woller in court for State of Wisconsin.
Case called for jury status hearing.
Parties have reached an agreement. 
State filed an amended information.
Defense acknowledges receipt of the amended information, waives further reading and enters a not guilty plea.
Court conducts plea colloquy.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 is dismissed outright. 
Recommendations by the State.  Recommendations by the Defense.  Statement by J.H.  Statement by defendant.

The Court Orders the Following:

Count 1:
FINE: $ 883.00
	
DNA Surcharge: $ 200.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid immediately after court today.   Failure to pay: will result in a civil judgment.
Defendant's Witness List filed by Atty. Bolles.

Motion for Continuance, filed by Atty. Bolles

**Reviewed by Judge Bohren on September 19, 2022 - Request is DENIED.**

Defense requests matter be set for trial.

09:30 AM Defendant Konrad S Hajdukiewicz appeared by Zoom with attorney David Andrew Bolles who appeared by Zoom.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  Attorney Bolles stands mute as to a plea.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  No unsupervised contact with Victim A.  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to have no violent contact with children.
